subject: Sleep
title: Sleep Deprivation and Worry
description: A quick win: understand Sleep Deprivation and Worry.

hook.text: After one night of poor sleep, minor problems feel catastrophic. Your worry amplifier is turned to maximum.

buildup.text: Sleep deprivation increases amygdala reactivity by up to 60 percent, amplifying emotional responses.

discovery.text: Simultaneously, the prefrontal cortex loses its ability to regulate the amygdala, removing the emotional brake.

twist.text: This means sleep-deprived people experience anxiety levels similar to clinical anxiety disorder patients.

climax.text: A single night of full recovery sleep can normalize amygdala reactivity and reduce worry significantly.

punchline.text: Everything feels worse when you're tired because it literally is worse in your brain.

quiz.question: What happens to amygdala reactivity after sleep deprivation?
options: It increases by up to 60 percent
